intro: Psoralea foliosa subsp. gazensis, commonly known as the Gazian leaf psoralea, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. It is often found in grasslands and along coastal areas, where it contributes to local biodiversity. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
